snippet: In 2010, Matt Green embarked on a cross-country hike. Now, unable to go back to a desk job, he has decided to walk on every street in New York City.

headline.main: Leaving His Footprints on the City
headline.print_headline: Leaving His Footprints on the City

snippet: Dr. Waltz made fundamental contributions to computer science in areas ranging from computer vision to machine learning.
abstract: David L Waltz, computer scientist whose early research in information retrieval provided the foundation for modern Internet search engines, dies at age 68.

headline.main: David L. Waltz, Computer Science Pioneer, Dies at 68
headline.print_headline: David L. Waltz, Computer Science Pioneer, Dies at 68

snippet: North Star, in Pound Ridge, N.Y., serves contemporary American cuisine from an experienced chef, Franz Fruhmann.
abstract: Alice Gabriel reviews North Star restaurant in Pound Ridge (Metropolitan/Westchester).

snippet: New York has hundreds of classes on sketch, improv and joke writing — storytelling is rapidly catching up.
abstract: Storytelling classes are emerging in New York City, joining the hundreds of classes on sketch, improv and joke writing that have become popular in recent years; David Crabb, who teaches storytelling at the Manhattan theater and bar Pit, says that the storyteller has to learn how to keep people's attention.

headline.main: So, There Were These Three Storytellers
headline.print_headline: So, There Were These Three Storytellers

snippet: An extraordinary historical project, begun in the 1970s, chronicles the inventor’s life and achievements.
abstract: Edmund Morris reviews book The Papers of Thomas A Edison: Volume 7: Losses and Loyalties, April 1883-December 1884, edited by Paul B Israel, Louis Carlat, Theresa M Collins and David Hochfelder.

snippet: ''They have a ridiculous amount of cash.'' Douglas J. Skinner, a professor of accounting at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business, talking about Apple. The company announced Monday that it would return some of its cash pile to shareho...

The stock market claimed an unlikely victim on Friday: one of its own.     Just as its shares started selling to the public for the first time, BATS Global Markets, one of the nation's newest and largest electronic exchanges, halted trading on its...
abstract: BATS Global Markets, one of the nation's newest and largest electronic stock exchanges, halts trading on its own stock following a series of technical glitches and errors in its system that also affected the shares of Apple and other companies; company withdraws its initial public offering following debacle; while trading on BATS quickly resumed, technical difficulties raise questions about the risks posed by the fast-paced and fragmented world of electronic exchanges to the broader investing world. Photos (M)

headline.main: A Fast-Paced Stock Exchange Trips Over Itself

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED and BEN PROTESS

snippet: NEW YORK -- Angry Birds Space, the new edition of the world's most popular mobile phone game, will appear on Apple and Android devices but not on Microsoft's Windows Phone platform, a top executive of the game's developer said Friday.     ''We're ...

headline.main: Angry Birds Bypasses Windows With Latest Edition

byline.original: By JON ERLICHMAN and DIANA BEN-AARON | BLOOMBERG NEWS

snippet: Oskar Eustis, the artistic director of the Public Theater, has put more distance between the theater and the monologist Mike Daisey, who was found to have fabricated details in his one-man show ''The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs,'' which ju...
abstract: Oskar Eustis, the artistic director of the Public Theater, criticizes the monologuist Mike Daisey, who was found to have fabricated details in his one-man show The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs, which just finished a hugely successful run at the Public. Photo (M)

headline.main: 'Audience Was Misled' by Daisey, The Public Theater Says
